regulation.title: Safety and Health Regulations for Construction - Electrical
regulation.applies_to: all electrical installations, equipment, and work practices in construction workplaces
excludes: existing permanent installations in place before construction commenced

rules.text: Installation safety requirements are contained in §§ 1926.402 through 1926.408. Included in this category are electric equipment and installations used to provide electric power and light on jobsites.
rules.requirement: comply with installation safety requirements for electrical equipment providing power and light

rules.text: Sections 1926.402 through 1926.408 contain installation safety requirements for electrical equipment and installations used to provide electric power and light at the jobsite. These sections apply to installations, both temporary and permanent, used on the jobsite.
rules.requirement: apply electrical safety requirements to all temporary and permanent electrical installations at jobsite
rules.applies_to: electrical equipment and installations at jobsite

items.description: existing permanent installations that were in place before construction activity commenced

rules.text: All electrical conductors and equipment shall be approved.
rules.requirement: use only approved electrical conductors and equipment

subsections.title: Examination, installation, and use of equipment

rules.text: The employer shall ensure that electrical equipment is free from recognized hazards that are likely to cause death or serious physical harm to employees.
rules.requirement: ensure electrical equipment is free from recognized hazards

subsections.title: Working space requirements (600 volts or less)

rules.text: Sufficient access and working space shall be provided and maintained about all electric equipment to permit ready and safe operation and maintenance of such equipment.
rules.requirement: provide sufficient access and working space around electrical equipment

rules.text: Working space shall not be less than 30 inches (762 mm) wide in front of the electric equipment.
rules.requirement: maintain minimum 30-inch width in front of electrical equipment

conditions.condition: workspace width in front of equipment

rules.text: The minimum headroom of working spaces about service equipment, switchboards, panelboards, or motor control centers shall be 6 feet 3 inches (1.91 m).
rules.requirement: maintain minimum 6 feet 3 inches headroom for electrical equipment working spaces
rules.applies_to: service equipment, switchboards, panelboards, motor control centers

rules.text: Live parts of electric equipment operating at 50 volts or more shall be guarded against accidental contact by cabinets or other forms of enclosures.
rules.requirement: guard live parts of electrical equipment 50V or more against accidental contact
rules.applies_to: electric equipment with live parts 50V or more

rules.text: Live parts may be guarded by elevation of 8 feet (2.44 m) or more above the floor or other working surface and so installed as to exclude unqualified persons.
rules.requirement: guard live parts by elevation of 8 feet or more above floor to exclude unqualified persons

conditions.condition: height above floor or working surface

rules.text: All 120-volt, single-phase, 15- and 20-ampere receptacle outlets on construction sites, which are not a part of the permanent wiring of the building or structure and which are in use by employees, shall have approved ground-fault circuit interrupters for personnel protection.
rules.requirement: install GFCI protection on all 120V, single-phase, 15A and 20A receptacles used by employees on construction sites
rules.applies_to: 120V single-phase 15A and 20A receptacles on construction sites

triggers.expression: voltage_120 AND single_phase AND amperage_15_20 AND construction_site AND employee_use

items.description: receptacles that are part of permanent building wiring
receptacles on two-wire, single-phase portable or vehicle-mounted generator rated not more than 5kW where circuit conductors are insulated from generator frame

rules.text: Each cord set, attachment cap, plug and receptacle of cord sets, and any equipment connected by cord and plug, except cord sets and receptacles which are fixed and not exposed to damage, shall be visually inspected before each day's use for external defects, such as deformed or missing pins or insulation damage, and for indications of possible internal damage.
rules.requirement: visually inspect all cord sets and plug-connected equipment daily before use for defects
rules.applies_to: cord sets, plugs, receptacles, and cord-connected equipment

items.description: cord sets and receptacles which are fixed and not exposed to damage

rules.text: All required tests shall be performed at intervals not to exceed 3 months, except that cord sets and receptacles which are fixed and not exposed to damage shall be tested at intervals not exceeding 6 months.
rules.requirement: test electrical equipment at maximum 3-month intervals, or 6 months for fixed unexposed equipment
rules.applies_to: electrical equipment under assured grounding program

conditions.condition: maximum test interval for fixed equipment

rules.text: Open conductors shall conform to minimum clearances of 10 feet (3.05 m) above finished grade, sidewalks, or from any platform or projection from which they might be reached.
rules.requirement: maintain minimum 10-foot clearance for open conductors above ground level

rules.text: Open conductors shall maintain 18 feet (5.49 m) clearance over public streets, alleys, roads, and driveways.
rules.requirement: maintain minimum 18-foot clearance over public streets and roadways

sections.title: Wiring methods, components, and equipment for general use

rules.text: Portable electric lighting used in wet and/or other conductive locations, as for example, drums, tanks, and vessels, shall be operated at 12 volts or less. However, 120-volt lights may be used if protected by a ground-fault circuit interrupter.
rules.requirement: use 12V or less lighting in wet/conductive locations, or 120V with GFCI protection
rules.applies_to: portable electric lighting in wet/conductive locations

rules.text: Extension cord sets used with portable electric tools and appliances shall be of three-wire type and shall be designed for hard or extra-hard usage.
rules.requirement: use three-wire hard or extra-hard usage extension cords for portable tools and appliances
rules.applies_to: extension cords for portable tools and appliances

rules.text: Fixtures, lampholders, lamps, rosettes, and receptacles shall have no live parts normally exposed to employee contact. However, rosettes and cleat-type lampholders and receptacles located at least 8 feet (2.44 m) above the floor may have exposed parts.
rules.requirement: ensure lighting fixtures have no exposed live parts, or locate at least 8 feet above floor

conditions.condition: no live parts exposed to employee contact

rules.text: The dimension of the working space in the direction of access to live parts which may require examination, adjustment, servicing, or maintenance while alive shall be a minimum of 2 feet 6 inches (762 mm).
rules.requirement: maintain minimum 30-inch working space for crane/hoist electrical components requiring live maintenance

rules.text: A disconnecting means shall be provided in the supply circuit for each motor-generator arc welder, and for each AC transformer and DC rectifier arc welder which is not equipped with a disconnect mounted as an integral part of the welder.
rules.requirement: provide disconnecting means for arc welders not equipped with integral disconnect
rules.applies_to: motor-generator, AC transformer, and DC rectifier arc welders

conditions.condition: welder not equipped with integral disconnect

rules.text: This section sets forth requirements for electric equipment and wiring in locations which are classified depending on the properties of the flammable vapors, liquids or gases, or combustible dusts or fibers which may be present.
rules.requirement: apply hazardous location requirements based on classification of flammable materials present
rules.applies_to: electrical equipment and wiring in hazardous locations

rules.text: Equipment and associated wiring approved as intrinsically safe is permitted in any hazardous (classified) location included in its listing or labeling.
rules.requirement: use only intrinsically safe equipment approved for specific hazardous location classification

rules.text: Conductors emerging from the ground shall be enclosed in raceways. Raceways installed on poles shall be of rigid metal conduit, intermediate metal conduit, PVC schedule 80 or equivalent extending from the ground line up to a point 8 feet (2.44 m) above finished grade.
rules.requirement: enclose underground conductors in raceways and protect pole-mounted raceways to 8 feet above grade

rules.text: A metallic enclosure shall be provided on the mobile machine for enclosing the terminals of the power cable. The enclosure shall include provisions for a solid connection for the ground wire(s) terminal to ground effectively the machine frame.
rules.requirement: provide metallic enclosure with proper grounding for mobile equipment power cable terminals

rules.text: A Class 1 power-limited circuit is supplied from a source having a rated output of not more than 30 volts and 1000 volt-amperes.
rules.requirement: limit Class 1 power-limited circuits to maximum 30 volts and 1000 volt-amperes

rules.text: The maximum circuit voltage is 150 volts AC or DC for a Class 2 inherently limited power source, and 100 volts AC or DC for a Class 3 inherently limited power source.
rules.requirement: limit Class 2 circuits to 150V max and Class 3 circuits to 100V max for inherently limited sources
rules.applies_to: Class 2 and Class 3 inherently limited circuits

rules.text: Communication circuits so located as to be exposed to accidental contact with light or power conductors operating at over 300 volts shall have each circuit so exposed provided with an approved protector.
rules.requirement: provide approved protectors for communication circuits exposed to power conductors over 300V
rules.applies_to: communication circuits near power conductors over 300V

rules.text: Indoor antennas, lead-ins, and other communication conductors attached as open conductors to the inside of buildings shall be located at least 2 inches (50.8 mm) from conductors of any light or power or Class 1 circuits.
rules.requirement: maintain minimum 2-inch separation between indoor communication conductors and power/Class 1 circuits

items.description: special and equally protective method of conductor separation is employed

rules.text: No employer shall permit an employee to work in such proximity to any part of an electric power circuit that the employee could contact the electric power circuit in the course of work, unless the employee is protected against electric shock by deenergizing the circuit and grounding it or by guarding it effectively by insulation or other means.
rules.requirement: protect employees from electric shock by deenergizing/grounding circuits or effective guarding
rules.applies_to: employees working near electric power circuits

conditions.condition: employee could contact circuit during work

rules.text: In work areas where the exact location of underground electric powerlines is unknown, employees using jack-hammers, bars, or other hand tools which may contact a line shall be provided with insulated protective gloves.
rules.requirement: provide insulated protective gloves when using tools that may contact unknown underground power lines
rules.applies_to: employees using hand tools in areas with unknown underground power lines

conditions.condition: exact location of underground lines unknown
using tools that may contact lines

rules.text: Before work is begun the employer shall ascertain by inquiry or direct observation, or by instruments, whether any part of an energized electric power circuit, exposed or concealed, is so located that the performance of the work may bring any person, tool, or machine into physical or electrical contact with the electric power circuit.
rules.requirement: determine location of energized circuits before beginning work through inquiry, observation, or instruments
rules.applies_to: all work that may involve contact with electric circuits

rules.text: Controls that are to be deactivated during the course of work on energized or deenergized equipment or circuits shall be tagged.
rules.requirement: tag controls that will be deactivated during electrical work
rules.applies_to: controls for electrical equipment and circuits

conditions.condition: controls to be deactivated during work

rules.text: Equipment or circuits that are deenergized shall be rendered inoperative and shall have tags attached at all points where such equipment or circuits can be energized.
rules.requirement: render deenergized equipment inoperative and tag all energization points

rules.text: The employer shall ensure that all wiring components and utilization equipment in hazardous locations are maintained in a dust-tight, dust-ignition-proof, or explosion-proof condition, as appropriate. There shall be no loose or missing screws, gaskets, threaded connections, seals, or other impairments to a tight condition.
rules.requirement: maintain electrical equipment in hazardous locations in proper dust-tight or explosion-proof condition

rules.text: Batteries of the unsealed type shall be located in enclosures with outside vents or in well ventilated rooms and shall be arranged so as to prevent the escape of fumes, gases, or electrolyte spray into other areas.
rules.requirement: locate unsealed batteries in ventilated enclosures to prevent fume escape

rules.text: Ventilation shall be provided to ensure diffusion of the gases from the battery and to prevent the accumulation of an explosive mixture.
rules.requirement: provide ventilation to prevent accumulation of explosive gas mixtures from batteries

rules.text: Racks and trays shall be substantial and shall be treated to make them resistant to the electrolyte.
rules.requirement: use substantial racks and trays with electrolyte-resistant treatment for batteries

rules.text: Floors shall be of acid resistant construction unless protected from acid accumulations.
rules.requirement: use acid-resistant floor construction or provide protection from acid accumulations

rules.text: Face shields, aprons, and rubber gloves shall be provided for workers handling acids or batteries.
rules.requirement: provide face shields, aprons, and rubber gloves for workers handling acids or batteries

rules.text: Facilities for quick drenching of the eyes and body shall be provided within 25 feet (7.62 m) of battery handling areas.
rules.requirement: provide emergency eyewash and body drenching facilities within 25 feet of battery areas

rules.text: Facilities shall be provided for flushing and neutralizing spilled electrolyte and for fire protection.
rules.requirement: provide facilities for flushing and neutralizing spilled electrolyte and fire protection

rules.text: Battery charging installations shall be located in areas designated for that purpose.
rules.requirement: locate battery charging installations in designated areas

rules.text: Charging apparatus shall be protected from damage by trucks.
rules.requirement: protect battery charging apparatus from truck damage

rules.text: When batteries are being charged, the vent caps shall be kept in place to avoid electrolyte spray. Vent caps shall be maintained in functioning condition.
rules.requirement: keep vent caps in place and functioning during battery charging to avoid electrolyte spray

subsections.title: Key electrical definitions with numerical criteria

rules.text: Hole means a gap or void 2 inches (5.1 cm) or more in its least dimension, in a floor, roof, or other walking/working surface.
rules.requirement: recognize gaps 2 inches or larger as holes requiring protection

rules.text: Opening means a gap or void 30 inches (76 cm) or more high and 18 inches (48 cm) or more wide, in a wall or partition, through which employees can fall to a lower level.
rules.requirement: recognize wall gaps 30+ inches high and 18+ inches wide as openings requiring protection

rules.text: Class I, Division 1 location is a location in which ignitible concentrations of flammable gases or vapors may exist under normal operating conditions, or may exist frequently because of repair or maintenance operations or because of leakage, or in which breakdown or faulty operation of equipment might release ignitible concentrations and cause simultaneous failure of electric equipment.
rules.requirement: classify locations with normal presence of flammable gases/vapors as Class I, Division 1

conditions.condition: equipment failure could release ignitible concentrations

rules.text: Volatile flammable liquid means a flammable liquid having a flash point below 38 degrees C (100 degrees F) or whose temperature is above its flash point, or a Class II combustible liquid having a vapor pressure not exceeding 40 psia (276 kPa) at 38°C (100°F) whose temperature is above its flash point.
rules.requirement: classify liquids with flash point below 100°F as volatile flammable liquids requiring special handling

rules.text: Readily accessible means capable of being reached quickly for operation, renewal, or inspections, without requiring those to whom ready access is requisite to climb over or remove obstacles or to resort to portable ladders, chairs, etc.
rules.requirement: ensure electrical equipment is readily accessible without obstacles or climbing aids

rules.text: Ampacity means the current in amperes a conductor can carry continuously under the conditions of use without exceeding its temperature rating.
rules.requirement: select conductors with adequate ampacity for continuous current without exceeding temperature rating

key_terms.approved: Acceptable to the authority enforcing this subpart (Assistant Secretary of Labor)
key_terms.qualified_person: One familiar with the construction and operation of the equipment and the hazards involved
key_terms.ground_fault_circuit_interrupter: A device for personnel protection that functions to deenergize a circuit when current to ground exceeds predetermined value
key_terms.hazardous_location: Locations classified as Class I, II, or III based on presence of flammable gases, vapors, combustible dusts, or easily ignitible fibers
key_terms.accessible: Admitting close approach; not guarded by locked doors, elevation, or other effective means
key_terms.ampacity: The current in amperes a conductor can carry continuously under conditions of use without exceeding temperature rating
key_terms.bonding: The permanent joining of metallic parts to form an electrically conductive path
key_terms.enclosure: The case or housing of apparatus, or fence/walls surrounding installation to prevent accidental contact with energized parts

hazardous_location_classes.class_i: Locations with flammable gases or vapors in air in quantities sufficient to produce explosive mixtures
hazardous_location_classes.class_ii: Locations hazardous because of presence of combustible dust
hazardous_location_classes.class_iii: Locations hazardous because of easily ignitible fibers or flyings

critical_requirements: Install GFCI protection on all 120V, 15A/20A construction site receptacles
Guard all live parts operating at 50V or more against accidental contact
Provide minimum 30-inch working space width in front of electrical equipment
Maintain proper clearances for overhead conductors (10ft minimum, 18ft over roadways)
Use only approved electrical conductors and equipment
Protect employees from electric shock through deenergizing/grounding or effective guarding
Implement proper lockout/tagout procedures for electrical work
Use appropriate equipment for hazardous classified locations
Provide emergency eyewash facilities within 25 feet of battery handling areas
Maintain proper ventilation for battery areas to prevent explosive gas accumulation
Use 12V or less lighting in wet/conductive locations (or 120V with GFCI)
Enclose underground conductors over 600V in proper raceways with 8ft pole protection
Maintain 2-inch minimum separation between communication and power conductors
Provide metallic enclosures with proper grounding for mobile equipment over 600V
inspection_points: Daily visual inspection of cord sets and plug-connected equipment for defects
Regular testing of electrical equipment (3-6 month intervals maximum)
Verification of GFCI functionality on construction site receptacles
Working space clearance measurements (30" minimum width, 75" headroom)
Hazardous location equipment condition and sealing assessment
Battery area ventilation and emergency equipment verification
Lockout/tagout tag placement and equipment isolation verification
Mobile equipment grounding and enclosure integrity checks
documentation_requirements: Written assured equipment grounding conductor program with specific procedures
Equipment testing records with employee identity, dates, trainer signatures
Lockout/tagout procedures, tags, and equipment identification
Hazardous location equipment listings, approvals, and classifications
Battery handling safety procedures and emergency response plans
High voltage equipment installation and maintenance records
Communication system installation documentation and clearance verification
